3. Mikis Theodorakis - Zorba 

This is not the 'Original Sountrack'. 
It is a contemporary transition by Orchestra 'Mikis Theodorakis' 
under the direction of the composer. Soloist Costas Papadopoulos. 
There is no recording date.

4. Mikis Theodorakis - Serpico (O.S.T.) (1973)

The original music written by Mikis Theodorakis for the film Sidney Lumet "Serpico". 
The movie (with Al Pacino), made great sense when released. The director had heard the music of Mikis Theodorakis and certainly like the music of his film to be written by Greek composer. 
The Mikis Theodorakis inspired the music of the film while it was on tour and recorded in a studio in New York. 
For the record used Philharmonic musicians and the best jazz soloists.


01. Theme From Serpico 
02. Honest Cop 
03. Alone In The Apartment 
04. Meeting In The Park 
05. Shoe Shop 
06. On The Streets 
07. Flashback 
08. Laurie's Fable 
09. Disillusion 
10. End Of Title




5. Mikis Theodorakis - State Of Siege (OST) (1973)

A large part of the music was removed from the film because Gavras considered that the epic of style would give the viewer a sense other than that originally had in mind. 
 Here are including the nine areas earmarked for the film. 
Recorded in Paris at Christmas 1972 and the musicians of the orchestra of M. Theodorakis accompany the Chilean band Los Calchakis, contributing decisively to the sound and tone of the total score. (in.gr)
